title: Bicycle motion:tabular and analytical part - d

content.question: According to the model, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>24</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>5</mn> <mi>sin</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>0.7</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B56@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, is Ruth's speed increasing or decreasing at time t=1.3 ? Give a reason reason for your answer.

frqParts.text: According to the model, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>24</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>5</mn> <mi>sin</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>0.7</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B56@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, is Ruth's speed increasing or decreasing at time t=1.3 ? Give a reason reason for your answer.

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
